column5: Well after an unsuccessful attempt at launching the boat yesterday, i had it in my mind i was fishing today no matter what lol. Woke up at 4am and trekked to look at launches, still another day or two away. Launch on the American side is good though. So i decided to find a shore fishing spot. First spot was good to go, a shallow river bay. The walk down was good until the sun started heating up lol then i was in 2 feet of snow haha. Nice sunny conditions, about plus 5, maybe 10km winds from the east. Water is crystal clear. StRted to set up and d'oh, brought the wrong tackle box lol. Still some decent lures to try. I started out by casting raps and got two nice big birds nests right away! Awesome! After I came to my senses i could see a few pike chasing or turning but not hitting my super slow presentation. Tried to speed up and the wouldnt even look. Then i switched to a Johnson silver minnow and started getting good hits! Sooo good of a feeling:) got 5 good bites and landed all those, ranging from 30-35". Then before heading home for a quick snack, i see a bigger fish:) i cast to her a few times and finally get her to bite! After a good fish i get her to shore and just as i grab her out pops the hook. Nothing huge but a nice thick fish, pushing 40". Awesome morning. I'm heading back down in an hour, with the right gear plus the silver minnow lol. I'm hoping my kiddos will come so we can snap a few pics this time:) pretty tough to get selfies with pike haha. I'm just excited, so fun to be out casting again!!!
Sounds good but I came for some fish porn.
ill try dood! Heading back down shortly with a camera kid. Lol Its jealousy I'd kill for some open water
Sounds like your having a blast!!!,we won't be to many weeks behind you lol.
The small bay im fishingview around 630 this morningview from my house, see the boat anchored on the ice in the center

Man cant even find a fish now:( beauty day out, must be +12 and no wind. Just got a visit from the MNR. Real nice guys, chatted about the new regs etc. they stayed for a good 20 minutes then off they went and checked 6 more boats
nice!  it's a great part of the world you live in

Well i only seen one more fish, she was a hearty beast but no take:) mid 40's id say. Was cool to see some youngens land a real nice sturgeon. They were stoked:). See. A few big ones jumping too, even they were enjoying the weather! I work nights this week so I'll be out there again all week  man I'm sore though lol. Earl bedtime tonight from all that fresh air:)
Wow, i live in the wrong part of ontario. I would take a 40 inch pike as my biggest for the year and be happy lol. Hope to see some gator pics soon!
